parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the ABS module can cause the loss of Anti-lock Braking System (ABS) and Electronic Stability Control (ESC) functions, leading to increased stopping distances, loss of vehicle control, and potential accidents.
symptoms: The ABS warning light
traction control warning light

and brake warning light illuminate; the brake pedal feels soft or spongy; the brake pedal sticks to the floor; the vehicle pulls to one side while braking; loss of power steering; faulty speedometer and gas gauge readings.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the ABS control module can cause the loss of anti-lock braking system (ABS) and electronic stability control (ESC) functionality, leading to reduced vehicle control and increased risk of accidents.
symptoms: The ABS
ESC
and brake lights illuminate on the dashboard
accompanied by audible warnings and beeps. The speedometer and fuel gauge may malfunction or stop working. The vehicle may experience sudden loss of traction
brake lock-up
or uncontrolled spinning.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the manufacturer to properly address the ABS control module failure issue through recalls and repairs can lead to continued safety risks for vehicle owners.
symptoms: Vehicle owners may experience difficulties in getting their vehicles repaired or replaced
despite the presence of a recall. The manufacturer may deny responsibility or charge exorbitant repair costs
leaving owners with unsafe vehicles.

parsedComplaintsResult.issueCategory: Concentric Slave Cylinder Failure and Clutch Master Cylinder Failure
parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the concentric slave cylinder and clutch master cylinder can cause the clutch pedal to stick to the floor, making it difficult or impossible to shift gears, which can lead to accidents or leave the driver stranded.
symptoms: The clutch pedal feels soft or spongy
the clutch pedal sticks to the floor
the clutch pedal does not return to its normal position
the clutch pedal has a delayed return to its normal position
the clutch pedal has a sudden loss of pressure
the vehicle is unable to shift into gear.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the ABS brake module can cause the vehicle to suddenly downshift to a lower gear, leading to loss of control and potential accidents.
symptoms: The ABS and traction control lights illuminate
the brake light blinks
the speedometer drops to zero
the transmission shifts erratically
the vehicle suddenly downshifts to a lower gear.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the DSG transmission can cause the vehicle to hesitate or jerk when shifting gears, leading to loss of control and potential accidents.
symptoms: The transmission hesitates or jerks when shifting gears
the vehicle suddenly loses power
the transmission slips or fails to engage
the vehicle jerks or lurches forward when accelerating.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the timing chain tensioner can cause the engine to fail, leading to loss of power and potential accidents.
symptoms: The engine surges or stalls
the timing chain tensioner fails
the engine oil leaks
the engine fails to start.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the ABS control module can cause the loss of anti-lock braking, traction control, and power steering, leading to a loss of vehicle control and increased risk of accidents.
symptoms: The ABS
traction control
and power steering warning lights illuminate on the dashboard
accompanied by audible beeps. The speedometer may drop to 0 mph
and the fuel gauge may display incorrect readings.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the electrical system can cause a loss of critical vehicle functions, including power steering, braking, and engine control, leading to a loss of vehicle control and increased risk of accidents.
symptoms: The dashboard warning lights illuminate
including the ABS
traction control
power steering
and engine warning lights. The speedometer may drop to 0 mph
and the fuel gauge may display incorrect readings.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of wiring and electrical components can cause a loss of critical vehicle functions, including power steering, braking, and engine control, leading to a loss of vehicle control and increased risk of accidents.
symptoms: The dashboard warning lights illuminate
including the ABS
traction control
power steering
and engine warning lights. The speedometer may drop to 0 mph
and the fuel gauge may display incorrect readings. In some cases
the wiring may catch fire.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the airbag system can cause the airbags to deploy incorrectly or not at all, leading to an increased risk of injury or death in the event of an accident.
symptoms: The airbag warning light illuminates on the dashboard
and the airbags may not deploy in the event of an accident.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The inaccuracy of the fuse box diagram can cause confusion and difficulty in diagnosing and repairing electrical system faults, leading to a loss of critical vehicle functions and increased risk of accidents.
symptoms: The fuse box diagram in the owner's manual does not match the actual fuse box configuration
making it difficult to diagnose and repair electrical system faults.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the engine coils can cause the engine to misfire, leading to a loss of power and increased risk of accidents.
symptoms: The engine misfires
and the check engine warning light illuminates on the dashboard.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the transmission can cause the vehicle to lose power and momentum, leading to a loss of vehicle control and increased risk of accidents.
symptoms: The transmission slips or fails to engage
and the check engine warning light illuminates on the dashboard.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the ABS control module can cause the loss of anti-lock braking system functionality, leading to increased stopping distances, loss of traction, and potential accidents.
symptoms: The ABS light comes on
the brake light flashes
the power steering system malfunctions
the speedometer and fuel gauge may not function
and the vehicle may experience sudden loss of power or stalling.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the electromechanical steering rack can cause loss of power steering assist, making it difficult to steer the vehicle, especially at low speeds, and increasing the risk of accidents.
symptoms: The power steering light comes on
the steering wheel feels stiff or heavy
and the vehicle may experience sudden loss of power steering assist.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the airbag clockspring can cause the airbag system to malfunction, potentially leading to the failure of the airbag to deploy in the event of a crash, which can result in serious injury or death.
symptoms: The airbag light comes on
the steering wheel-mounted buttons and lights may flicker or fail to function
and the airbag system may not deploy properly in the event of a crash.
